(AP Photo/Luca Bruno)
DOHA, Qatar (AP) ï¿½ Luis Enrique was replaced by Luis de la Fuente as Spain's coach on Thursday, two days after the national team was eliminated in the round of 16 at the World Cup.
details.reused_text: Luis Enrique had said he wasn't planning to relinquish the "tiki-taka" if he remained as coach, and De la Fuente also is likely to keep it alive.

details.source_text: He said he would have liked to stay with the national team ï¿½forever,ï¿½ but knew that it might not be possible.

ï¿½What the national team needs is support, in all its meaning, so Luis de la Fuente can achieve the goals.ï¿½

The 61-year-old De la Fuente, a former left back with Sevilla and Athletic Bilbao, helped Spain's under-19 squad win the European Championship in 2015, and the under-21 team win Euro 2019.
details.reused_text: De la Fuente is expected to make his debut with the senior team when Spain resumes playing in qualifying for Euro 2024 in March next year.
